a.g: When the victory of Allah has come and the conquest,
And you see the people entering into the religion of Allah in multitudes,
Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل: ﴿ فسبح بحمد ربك واستغفره إنه كان توابا ﴾ {} وكان ﭬ يكثر أن يقول (سبحانك اللهم وبحمدك اللهم اغفر لي إنك أنت التواب الرحيم[108]) وقال ﭬ: (من أكثر من الاستغفار جعل الله عز وجل له من كل هم فرجا ومن كل ضيق مخرجا وارزقه من حيث لا يحتسب[109]) وقال ﭬ: (إني لأستغفر الله تعالى وأتوب إليه في اليوم سبعين مرة[110]) هذا مع أنه ﭬ غفر له ما تقدم من ذنبه وما تأخر وقال ﭬ: (إنه ليغان على قلبي حتى إني لأستغفر الله تعالى في كل يوم مائة مرة[111])
Indeed, the Mighty and Majestic has said: "So glorify the praises of your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance [tawwab]." And He, peace and blessings be upon him, would frequently say: "Glory be to You, O Allah, and with Your praise. O Allah, forgive me. Indeed, You are the Accepter of Repentance [tawwab], the Most Merciful [rahim]." And He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever increases in seeking forgiveness [istighfar], Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will make for him from every anxiety a relief, and from every constraint an opening, and will provide for him from where he does not expect." And He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, I seek forgiveness [istighfar] from Allah, the Exalted, and repent [atubu] to Him seventy times a day." This, despite the fact that He, peace and blessings be upon him, had been forgiven for what preceded of his sin and what would follow. And He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, a veil [ghayyan] covers my heart [qalb] until I seek forgiveness [astaghfir] from Allah, the Exalted, one hundred times every day."
